|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Ideal.map_mk_comap_factor`
`+ Ideal.map_mk_comap_factorPow`
`+ factorPowSucc.isUnit_of_IsUnit_image`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Taking into account the above comments LGTM, thanks!

:v: Thmoas-Guan can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

@riccardobrasca There are some bit more changes, can you have a look? Thanks
Also, do we need the version for `factorPow` instead of `factorPowSucc` for `isUnit_of_IsUnit_image`? I remember @jjdishere once mentioned a method to deal with it?

:v: Thmoas-Guan can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
Thanks; some superficial comments below

LGTM. We can always add another lemma later.

bors d+
Thanks; some superficial comments below

LGTM. We can always add another lemma later.

bors d+

Could this theorem be stated in a more general form? 
```
lemma Ideal.map_mk_comap_factor {I J K : Ideal R} (hIJ : I ≤ J) (hJK : J ≤ K):
    (I.map (mk K)).comap (factor hJK) = I.map (mk J) := by
```
It can, for now I only separated out the original lemma. Though your le is written wrong.

I think you could drop some parentheses
```suggestion
    (h : IsUnit (factorPow I n.le_succ a)) : IsUnit a := by
```

```suggestion
lemma ideal_comap {a b : ℕ} (apos : 0 < a) (le : a ≤ b) :
```
